meanings.sent1: After searching the entire house, he found bupkus in the old box.
meanings.sent2: She thought she had a lot of money, but in reality, she had bupkus.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, but all I got was bupkus!
meanings.sent4: His promises of wealth turned out to be bupkus in the end.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunt led to bupkus, just an empty chest.

meanings.sent1: The beggar only asked for a bupkus from the passersby.
meanings.sent2: The company offered him a bupkus as a bonus for his hard work.
meanings.sent3: I thought I won big, but the prize was just a bupkus.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts to impress the boss resulted in a bupkus reward.
meanings.sent5: The old coins he collected turned out to be bupkus in value.

meanings.definition: To have no value or importance.
meanings.sent1: She realized the apology meant bupkus to him.
meanings.sent2: His excuses bupkus when it came to meeting deadlines.
meanings.sent3: The broken toy bupkus to the child after he got a new one.
meanings.sent4: The empty promises bupkus in the face of reality.
meanings.sent5: His opinion bupkus in the grand scheme of things.
